name: MedTeam Team Dispute
description: Random team conflict — Dani advocates rest, Marsh demands data, or Priya reports equipment anomaly.

data.label: Dani Advocates Rest
data.message:
Nurse Dani: *steps between Dr. Marsh and the pump controls* "Doctor, I need to flag this. Heart rate has been elevated for the last four minutes. Respiration is shallow and accelerating. I'm recommending a mandatory rest period before any further inflation."

Dr. Marsh: *doesn't look up from her tablet* "Your recommendation is noted in the log, Dani. However, the protocol specifies rest periods at my discretion, not yours."

Nurse Dani: "With respect, Doctor — the protocol also specifies that nursing staff can invoke a welfare hold if vitals exceed—"

Dr. Marsh: *finally looks up, voice even* "Are they exceeding threshold?"

Nurse Dani: *checks the monitor* "...Not yet. But the trend—"

Dr. Marsh: "Then we continue. Priya, maintain current settings. Dani — document your concerns in the session notes. I will review them after we collect the next data set."

Nurse Dani: *jaw tight, turns back to [Player]* "I've noted it officially. Just keep breathing for me."

data.label: Marsh Demands More Data
data.preMessage:
Dr. Marsh: *frowning at her tablet* "The last three readings are inconclusive. The accommodation curve isn't matching any of my models." *taps the screen irritably* "I need more data points. Priya — four rapid pulses. I want to see the instantaneous pressure response."

Nurse Dani: "Doctor, four pulses in quick succession at this stage—"

Dr. Marsh: "Will produce exactly the data variance I need to recalibrate the model. Priya."

Nurse Priya: *glances between them* "...Four pulses, confirmed."
data.postMessage:
Dr. Marsh: *studying the spike patterns on her tablet* "There. See that response curve? The third pulse produced a 0.3 PSI deviation from the second. That's the data point I needed."

Nurse Dani: *monitoring [Player] closely* "Heart rate spiked to 108 during the sequence. Settling now."

Dr. Marsh: "Acceptable parameters. Log the pulse series as Supplemental Data Set 4."

data.label: Priya Reports Anomaly
data.preMessage:
Nurse Priya: *frowning at the pressure gauge* "Doctor — I'm seeing something unusual. The backflow valve is showing intermittent readings. Pressure is holding but the gauge needle is flickering."

Dr. Marsh: *looks up immediately* "Flickering how? Rhythmic or random?"

Nurse Priya: "Random. Could be a sensor fault or a micro-leak in the seal. I'd like to run a diagnostic pulse — two short bursts to test line integrity."

Dr. Marsh: "Do it. Dani, watch the vitals during the diagnostic."

Nurse Priya: "Diagnostic pulse, two bursts."
data.postMessage:
Nurse Priya: *watches the gauge carefully through both pulses* "Pressure response is clean on both bursts. Gauge needle held steady. I think it was a sensor artifact — I'll swap the transducer at the next break."

Dr. Marsh: "Good catch, Priya. Log the anomaly and your diagnostic findings."

Nurse Dani: "No vitals changes during the diagnostic. [Player]'s stable."

Dr. Marsh: "Then we resume standard protocol. The interruption cost us forty seconds of data collection time." *clicks her recorder* "Note: equipment diagnostic at timestamp — no protocol deviation required."
